text: hi my name is matt lewis and i'm chief
architect
at the drive and vehicle licensing
agency in the uk
it's my responsibility to set out the
technical direction of our strategic
platforms
and to guide solutions that operate
against our critical data sets
and this includes all drivers in great
britain and all vehicles in the uk
we've been an aws customer for over five
years
and over that time we've delivered many
workloads using service technologies
utilizing services like api gateway
lambda and dynamodb we operate a
container platform
that's recently migrated to eks
and we enforce compliance using services
such as
aws config cloud trail and guard duty
amongst others
i'm an aws certified solution
architecture professional level
and the native breast certified security
specialist as well as
having the great honor of being an aws
data hero for many years
we've had a cloud-first principle and
we've been able to take advantage of the
elasticity of public cloud
and the on-demand self-service model
this has allowed us to deliver business
value early
and get services out in front of our
customers
but our biggest challenge was how to
reduce the reliance we had
on suppliers and how to grow the skills
in-house
putting us in control of our own destiny
to achieve that we've actively targeted
aws certifications
we've given people time and access to
training
we've given them exam vouchers and
sample environments
and we set up study groups we set out to
make learning
fun we've run events such as deep race
today
hackathons and multiple game days we've
also rewarded people
with trips to events such as aws summits
and re invent
and we now have over half of our entire
cloud engineering capability
certified to a least associate level
with many also going down professional
and specialty paths
and this number is rapidly rising
as a result we've been able to bring
this capability
entirely in house and we estimate that
this will save us over 16 million pound
in operating costs
over the next 10 years but there's more
growing our skills through training and
certification
has resulted in less rework to the
services that we developed today
and this is the result of making better
well-informed decisions first time
it's also given us the confidence to
learn and to try out new services
as they're released we launched the
first custom voice skill
in uk central government using alexa
we use machine learning services like
recognition
to help assist internal staff with basic
validation of photographs and signatures
we've greatly simplified our network
design removing almost all vpc appearing
using network manager and transit
gateway
and as an example of cost optimization
we have taken
around 75 percent of all compute cost
out of the container platform as we've
evolved
from on demand to reserved to spot
instances
and as we've learned we've begun
automating best practice
so we've baked features such as
monitoring metrics and alerting
into our platform we've built
vulnerability scanning
integration and acceptance testing and
zero downtime deployments
into our pipeline which also checks for
conformance against
internal dvla code standards and in
today's uncertain world
this has allowed us to react with speed
and agility
and release more new services over the
past 12 months
than ever before and what's next
we've just launched our cloud academy
and this is our way
of developing a pipeline of talent as we
grow the next generation of cloud
engineers
and this has a training program that
fits around aws certification
so if you're thinking about beginning
your journey to cloud or you want to
enhance your existing knowledge
what's stopping you go online and check
out the free
digital training and resources that are
available watch back
the sessions from reinvent and set
yourself the goal
of becoming aws certified
thank you for watching
you
